description: ES File Explorer is a third-party Android app that allows users to explore and manage their files. In 2019, Google removed ES File Explorer from the Google Play Store, claiming that the app (and other Baidu apps) were committing click fraud.

One of the files ES File Explorer creates and places on a user's device is a USERRETURN file. This file contains two unique, user-specific numbers. However, what these numbers are used for is unknown.
